action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the potted plant in the freezer, the plate on the table and the mop in the refrigerator.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe and a bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. In the wardrobe there is a pillow.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a living room, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You are in a living room now. There are a book, a couch, a chair, a side table, a shelf and a table. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a kitchen and a hallway here.
You put the plate on the table.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a living room, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
The potted plant is already in your inventory.
You are in a broom closet now. There are a broom and a mop. The broom is on the floor. The mop is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The mop is already in your inventory.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a bedroom, a living room, a broom closet and a kitchen here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
The freezer is now open. The freezer is empty.
You can't see a potted plant here.
You can't see a potted plant here.
You can't see a potted plant here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'inventory' action.
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a orange, a sandwich, a banana, a peach and a apple.
You can't see a mop here.
You can't see a mop here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.
> put mop from inventory in refrigerator
I don't know what you mean.
You can't see a mop here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'use' action.
You can't see a mop here.
You can't see a mop here.
> transfer mop from inventory to refrigerator
I don't know how to interpret this 'transfer' action.
I don't know what 'my mop' means.
I don't know how to interpret this 'store' action.
You can't see a mop here.
You can't see a potted plant here.
> remove potted plant from inventory and place in freezer
I don't know how to interpret this 'remove' action.
You can't see a potted plant here.
I don't know how to interpret this 'insert' action.
> put held potted plant in freezer
I don't know what you mean.
You can't see a potted plant here.
> put carried potted plant in freezer
I don't know what you mean.
You can't see a potted plant here.
You can't see a potted plant here.
> put potted plant from inventory in freezer
I don't know what you mean.
> set down potted plant in freezer
I don't know how to interpret this 'set' action.
I don't know what 'inside freezer' means.
You can't see a potted plant here.
